conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C and D. Predict which container (E or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
A, B, C, and D are the starting points of the liquid.
E and F are the containers that receive the liquid.
Stream A hits the grey baffle and is deflected to the right.
Stream B and C strike the yellow slanted barrier, merge and are deflected to the left together.
Stream D strikes the blue slanted barrier and is deflected to the left.
Stream A hits the yellow baffle and is deflected to the left.
Stream A merges with Stream B and C, then encounters the red baffle and is deflected to the left together.
Stream D flows along the blue slanted barrier without changing its direction.

premise: Stream A, B, and C merge and are deflected to the left by the red baffle.
conclusion: Most liquid from A, B, and C ends in container F.

premise: Stream D flows along the blue slanted barrier without changing direction.
conclusion: Most liquid from D reaches container E.
